title: Tomáš Porubský
text:
Tomáš Porubský (2 September 1914 – 19 June 1973) was a Slovak <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> and appeared for both the <a href="Czechoslovakia%20national%20football%20team">Czechoslovakia</a> and <a href="Slovakia%20national%20football%20team">Slovakia</a> national teams.
Career.
Porubský earned his first and only <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="Czechoslovakia%20national%20football%20team">Czechoslovakia</a> on 23 May 1937 in the <a href="1936%E2%80%9338%20Central%20European%20International%20Cup">1936–38 Central European International Cup</a> against <a href="Italy%20national%20football%20team">Italy</a>, which finished as a 0–1 loss in <a href="Prague">Prague</a>. He later represented the <a href="Slovakia%20national%20football%20team">Slovakia national team</a>, making his first appearance on 3 December 1939 in a <a href="Exhibition%20game">friendly</a> match against <a href="Germany%20national%20football%20team">Germany</a>, which finished as a 1–3 loss in <a href="Chemnitz">Chemnitz</a>. He was capped 14 times for Slovakia, making his final appearance on 13 June 1943 in a friendly against <a href="Romania%20national%20football%20team">Romania</a>, which finished as a 2–2 draw in <a href="Bucharest">Bucharest</a>.
Personal life.
Porubský died on 19 June 1973 at the age of 58.
